dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, we've got some interesting numbers out from the latest Allianz Market Perceptions Study.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, we've got some interesting numbers out from the latest Allianz Market Perceptions Study.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: more Americans are worrying about a looming downturn this year, according to the latest Allianz Quarterly Market Perceptions Study.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I'm looking at it now, and it's kinda surprising, right? Given everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I'm looking at it now, and it's kinda surprising, right? Given everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? I mean, despite a really strong economic performance, it seems like more Americans are actually feeling pretty optimistic about the year ahead.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? I mean, despite a really strong economic performance, it seems like more Americans are actually feeling pretty optimistic about the year ahead.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: more Americans are worrying about a looming downturn this year, according to the latest Allianz Quarterly Market Perceptions Study. 50% of respondents see a major recession right around the corner, an increase from 46% earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, it's a definite vibe shift. We're seeing fewer people worried about a major recession now, which is, like, a good sign for growing confidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, it's a definite vibe shift. We're seeing fewer people worried about a major recession now, which is, like, a good sign for growing confidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 50% of respondents see a major recession right around the corner, an increase from 46% earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And that's translating into investment sentiment too, it seems. A decent chunk of people are saying it's a good time to actually jump into the market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And that's translating into investment sentiment too, it seems. A decent chunk of people are saying it's a good time to actually jump into the market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fewer people are saying now is a good time to invest in the market: only 35% of respondents, compared with over 40% at the beginning of the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Mmm-hmm. But, you know, the generational divide is still pretty stark here. Like, Baby Boomers, they're the most concerned about a downturn.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm-hmm. But, you know, the generational divide is still pretty stark here. Like, Baby Boomers, they're the most concerned about a downturn.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Millennials remain the most concerned out of any generation: 56% said they are worried about a major market downturn on the horizon, compared to 51% of Gen Xers and 46% of Baby Boomers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but then, [interrupts] on the flip side, they're also the most comfortable with market volatility. Itâ€™s almost like they're more willing to invest right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but then, on the flip side, they're also the most comfortable with market volatility. It's almost like they're more willing to invest right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On the flip side, Millennials are the most comfortable with recent market volatility: 47% would invest now, compared with just 17% of boomers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's kinda counter-intuitive, isn't it? Kelly LaVigne from Allianz mentioned it's probably because they, uh, have more time to recover from potential losses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's kinda counter-intuitive, isn't it? Kelly LaVigne from Allianz mentioned it's probably because they, uh, have more time to recover from potential losses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Millennials might be most worried about a recession, they seem to be feeling more at peace about their situationlikely because they have more time to recover from any major losses, describes Kelly LaVigne, vice president of Advanced Markets, Allianz Life.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That makes sense. They're maybe more established. And speaking of fears, there's a shift too in how people are thinking about retirement savings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That makes sense. They're maybe more established. And speaking of fears, there's a shift too in how people are thinking about retirement savings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it looks like fewer people are focusing on products totally shielded from market losses. It's an interesting trend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it looks like fewer people are focusing on products totally shielded from market losses. It's an interesting trend.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recession fears have also resulted in fewer people saying its important to have retirement savings in financial products shielded from market losses: only 66%, compared to 72% last quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, LaVigne also said that market volatility, like, totally took a vacation this summer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, LaVigne also said that market volatility, like, totally took a vacation this summer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Market volatility didnt take a vacation this summer, LaVigne said in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: True! And that's a big part of it. Plus, um, trade negotiations with China looking bright, and the Treasury yields are pointing towards economic growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True! And that's a big part of it. Plus, um, trade negotiations with China looking bright, and the Treasury yields are pointing towards economic growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ongoing uncertainty over trade negotiations with Chinascheduled to resume on Thursdaycontinue to take center stage and stoke recession fears, as prospects for a comprehensive trade deal look gloomy. Whats more, the yield for the three-month Treasury has been higher than the ten-year Treasury since May: Known as an inverted yield curve, its a major indicator that has predicted the past seven recessions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, all in all, it's a pretty positive outlook. People are feeling good about the market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, all in all, it's a pretty positive outlook. People are feeling good about the market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid a backdrop of slowing economic growth, ongoing geopolitical concerns and almost 15 months of trade tensions, more Americans are worrying about a looming downturn this year, according to the latest Allianz Quarterly Market Perceptions Study.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I mean, it's a nice change of pace, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. I mean, it's a nice change of pace, right?
